intro: Polhillia ignota, commonly known as the ghost flower, is a striking plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its unique, lantern-shaped flowers that resemble ghostly orbs. The plant produces vibrant purple and white blooms that are highly ornamental and attract various pollinators. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and containers. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens for conservation and display.
